thread.title: HSBC to Pay $101.5 Million to Resolve Federal Fraud Charges

author: Maria Armental
title: HSBC to Pay $101.5 Million to Resolve Federal Fraud Charges

organizations.name: resolve federal fraud charges hsbc holdings plc

text:
HSBC Holdings PLC has agreed to pay $101.5 million to resolve federal fraud charges stemming from the bankâ€™s misuse of confidential client information for its own profit, a practice commonly known as front-running.
In documents filed Thursday in Brooklyn federal court, HSBC admitted to using confidential information in two instances for its own profit.
